page.title: 10JACK WHITE-ELDWICKIAN
page.content: One of the most well known characters in the area is the retired{huntsman {of the Airedale Beagles,Jack White. Born in Eldwick,Jack tells how life has changed here in the last fifty years.Every farm used to have dairy herds,pigs and hens and sell milk to locals.Some was taken to Bingley and sent by train to Bradford in churns. For thirty eight years Jack lived at the Huntsman's Cottage next to the beagle kennels.He travelled all over the North of England with his pack. At home in Eldwick Jack has his own collection of hunting horns,models, and photos.An oil painting of Jack in Patterdale with the hunt is treasured. In his workshop he makes tack for friends.{Jack uses leather,wax,and {thread with lots of handtools to make {bridles,head-collars,lead reins,crops, {whips,stirrup leathers and harnesses.
